timeline.bodyText: Nit: not really sure how to use this information unless we include more Pycharm setup docs.
timeline.author: mschwager
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -82,6 +82,8 @@ ocamlmerlin -version  # just checking ocamlmerlin is in your PATH
 code .
 ```
 
+For Python, Pycharm is good.

replies.bodyText: it's just a regular Python project so there's really no setup. I just don't want people to try to use the objectively worse VSCode python extension since we say "VSCode" above.
replies.author: rcoh

timeline.bodyText:
You probably want to install with --dev

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            pipenv install
          
          
            
            pipenv install --dev
timeline.author: brendongo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -53,15 +53,15 @@ If you want to test semgrep on a directory with a set of given rules, run:
 ```bash
 cp ./semgrep_core/_build/default/bin/main_semgrep_core.exe /usr/local/bin/semgrep_core
 cd semgrep
-make && make install
-semgrep --config <YAML_FILE_OR_DIRECTORY> <code to check>
-```
-
-It is also possible to run semgrep from source:
-
-```text
-cd semgrep
-python3 -m semgrep
+pipenv install
